Package my.battleship

Interface Player

All Known Implementing Classes:
TemplatePlayer
public interface Player
Defines the interface between the platform and an individual player. In addition to implementing this interface, each player's class must provide a public, no-argument constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String getRealName()
    Gets this player's real name (first and last name please).
    java.lang.String getSchool()
    Gets this player's school, for instance "Century", "John Marshall", or "Mayo"
    java.lang.String getScreenName()
    Gets this player's "screen name".
    void startGame​(Platform platform)
    Play a game.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      void startGame​(Platform platform)
      Play a game. An implementation should repeatedly call Platform.shoot(int, int) until the ShotStatus is one of the SUNK_ALL_* enumerations. If you return prior to doing so, you are effectively giving up. If you take too long to decide where to shoot, you may be removed from the game.
      Parameters:
      platform - -- the game platform to be played.

    • getScreenName

      java.lang.String getScreenName()
      Gets this player's "screen name".
      Returns:
      String of the player's screen name

    • getRealName

      java.lang.String getRealName()
      Gets this player's real name (first and last name please).
      Returns:
      String of the player's real name

    • getSchool

      java.lang.String getSchool()
      Gets this player's school, for instance "Century", "John Marshall", or "Mayo"
      Returns:
      String of the player's school
